property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A man preparing stacks of bread in southern Afghanistan

note.text: Traditional Afghan cuisine involves rice served with meat and vegetables. “Qabili palau” is rice and lamb cooked with lentils, raisins, and carrots. “Bolani” or “borekai” is a flatbread stuffed with vegetables like leek, pumpkin, or potato. “Mantwo” are dumplings stuffed with meat and Afghan spices. “Chai sabz,” green tea, is nearly always served.
Alcohol is forbidden under Islamic law.
